properties.areaDesc: Larimer, CO; Weld, CO; Boulder, CO
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 1 at 9:10PM MST until March 1 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southwestern Weld County in northeastern Colorado...
Southeastern Larimer County in north central Colorado...
Northeastern Boulder County in northeastern Colorado...

* Until 1000 PM MST.

* At 910 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from Fort Collins to 3 miles northwest of Niwot, or along
a line extending from 18 miles west of Greeley to 29 miles
northwest of Denver, moving east at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 234 and 272.

Locations impacted include...
Fort Collins, western Greeley, northern Boulder, Longmont, Loveland,
Windsor, Erie, Firestone, Johnstown, Frederick, Milliken, Berthoud,
Dacono, Mead, Severance, Platteville, Lyons, Timnath, Masonville and
Carter Lake.
properties.instruction:
Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are
expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden
whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 10:00 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
